comment: uhhh pay attention in class and its an easy A, ts ppl played Minecraft the entire time and wonder how they failed

Terrible professor, not worth taking. It is one thing having a rigorous class but at least a good grade can be achieved by studying material. However there is no clear outline on how to study, even his study guides are COMPLETELY POINTLESS. Worst class I've ever taken. Almost half of the class dropped by cutoff date, surprised he still has a job.
DON'T DO IT YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED

No, ik what you're thinking maybe all of these reviews are over exaggerated but they aren't! Attendance is required, He reads straight off the powerpoint for every lecture and he is real monotone, He doesn't come to labs while the TA try's to help your on your own. The study guides is just a list of things you should know no practice or questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Doesn't give any homework's or quizzes
Nah man, just no. hn
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Listen to the other reviews avg for exams were 50% with no curve labs are poorly thought out trust me just waitlist another prof
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!Terrible professor, no clear way to study. Monotone and reads slides directly.

AVOID- This is a terrible professor. He seems like a nice person, but cannot instruct and then said our class did the worst on a test he did not prepare us for. He only runs through slides. He has a monotone, boring lecture, and does not assist with labs and textbook homework material. The labs are poorly outlined and he expects us to use ChatGPT.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He intends well and certainly understands what he is teaching but he works a full-time job and has no time to spare for his students. His tests are very difficult but the questions total up to 130 points which is nice. He gives partial credit but it does not offset the difficulty. It's hard to know what to study as well.

Lab instructors did a great job helping with labs and final project. The material is interesting but the lectures are mind-numbingly boring. Exams are a mixed bag. He gives out long and really vague study guides so exam difficulty is pretty much based on if you were lucky enough to review the right material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Labs were not that bad, TA's were good. Lecture was super boring and you'd get a study guide for the test that had a million things on it but only 6 of those showed up on the test so good luck studying for those.

Genuine guy, but he's not equipped to teach any college class. Lectures are monotonous and painfully boring. Labs are especially horrendous. Every single one so far has been poorly thought out and impossible to complete without a TA constantly looking over your shoulder. At the very least, exams weren't to difficult.

This new professor's class was poorly run. Tests were not difficult, but stringent grading made them challenging. Regurgitate the slides to do well. Labs were terrible, with issues often directed to Google or ChatGPT. His teaching style involved reading PowerPoints and asking too many trick questions, which hindered participation
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: There were 4 quizzes, and in 3 out of the 4, over half the class failed.  Luckily there were a couple of people who helped other teams during the labs, one dude would try to answer questions for us that Levine couldn't.  He would also point out issues and would not give up, I hope he passed the class because he would not let up

I give him some slack, Fall 2023 was his first semester teaching, and he is better in Spring 2024. He's a smart guy and accessible outside class. Class is hard, exams cover a lot of material but he gives some bonus points. Labs are the worst part, if you hit a bug you're on your own cause BBB sucks. Very genuine guy, he will improve more overtime.
Difficult semester and became somewhat understanding at the end. Test where just something else

This class was extremely tough. Tests felt graded on RNG if you didn't use certain keywords and the material each covered could be 100s of slides. Labs had trick questions & the Beaglebone was a mess to use.

There was improvement throughout the semester though and this was his first semester. Hopefully he continues that trend for future classes.
Ever play Doom Eternal? Yeah, thats the type of experience you'll get out of this professor. Enough said right there.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment:
Lecture heavy: tests cover 200+ slides between each. Make your notes as you go. 
Test heavy: He will maybe give you study guides but only tests 2 of 6 sections.
Tough grader: wording accuracy is the big killer.
Group labs + final lab: Went there x2 a week bc the TA & prof were not helpful with what was expected on the lab and problems on BB board.

Maybe he'll improve after a bit more experience but his grading is horrendous. Get half the question right? 3/20 grade. The labs and quizzes are tough to understand let alone answer. He also kept changing the expectations for our final. Lectures were monotone and hard to follow.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: This class was stressful and difficult. He made the quizzes a bit better towards the end. You need to memorize a lot of material, and you need to be specific (but not too specific with your answer) on tests. The labs seemed ok, but could easily take hours on end if it didn't work for you. Many people went to two labs a week bc of time

It was his first semester teaching so he might improve but he is a very tedious grader. He gave extra credit quizzes but hardly anyone got them right. There is a group project at the end and the labs are all group labs but shouldn't be. His tests are very old school and doesn't like to use online tests.
Very difficult class. He was not helpful at all in lab so be prepared to put in a good amount of effort
Idk why they are lying in here lol. He had to be one of the worst professors at this university. I will say he improved at the end just a bit.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: He was honestly ok but his teaching and grading methods could use some work. For anyone taking his class, I would prepare for the difficult moments And do your best.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Stay away from him!!!! The test are hard and he provides a handful of information on the study guide and picks 3-4 questions from it and break them into parts smh.
Dang bruh this class was so easy! Might take it again for fun. Graduating next semester yo!

Do not be deceived by the last review! My experience was so distorted that idk how to comprehend the lectures! There were 800 slides that had to be memorized for the exam. I was struggling hard. Save yourself!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This has been the best professor I have ever had in my life! My goodness, if I had to retake the class, I would retake it another lifetime. the experience was extremely memorable that for everyday in class, I came! A lot truly!
